title: Mahomes tears ACL as Chiefs' playoff hopes end
content: Patrick Mahomes suffered a torn ACL in the closing minutes of Sunday's loss to the Chargers, an MRI confirmed. "Don't know why this had to happen," he wrote on social media. "And not going to lie, [it] hurts."

title: Source: Pack's Parsons believed to have torn ACL
content: The initial belief is that the Packers' Micah Parsons suffered a torn ACL, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Rivers nearly helps Colts win in stunning return
content: In his stunning return after nearly five full seasons in retirement, Philip Rivers started at quarterback for the Colts and positioned them to win before a late collapse by Indy in an 18-16 loss to the Seahawks on Sunday.

title: Aggies shock unbeaten volleyball No. 1 Huskers
content: The NCAA women's volleyball tournament was rocked Sunday as Texas A&M upset previously unbeaten No. 1 Nebraska 3-2, sending the Aggies to the program's first final four.

title: Lawrence 'on fire,' accounts for 6 TDs in Jags win
content: Trevor Lawrence threw for 330 yards and a career-high five touchdowns and ran for another in the Jaguars' 48-20 rout of the Jets at EverBank Stadium.

content: Chargers safety Tony Jefferson was ejected after a helmet-to-helmet hit on Chiefs wide receiver Tyquan Thornton in the fourth quarter Sunday and left the field in frustration, making an obscene gesture toward fans.

content: The Trump administration will begin on Monday enhanced screening and vetting of H-1B and its dependent H-4 visa applicants, including checks of their social media profiles.

content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday condemned a deadly mass shooting at a Jewish festival in Sydney, Australia as "a purely antisemitic attack."

content: The BJP Manipur Legislature Party meeting in Delhi on Sunday discussed peace and progress in the state. The meeting was attended by more than 30 MLAs, including two from the Kuki community.

content: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin, who was elevated to the position of the BJP's Working President, told NDTV today that his priority would be to strengthen the party organisation.

content: Australia has experienced a string of antisemitic attacks on synagogues, buildings and cars since the beginning of Israel's war in Gaza in October 2023.

title: Man Who Killed US Soldiers Was Part Of Syria's Security Forces
content: Syria's interior ministry said Sunday that the gunman who killed three Americans in the central Palmyra region the previous day was a member of the security forces who was set to be fired for extremism.

title: Only 48% Turnout In Punjab's Rural Body Polls, Opposition Alleges Violence
content: Polling for Punjab's zila parishad and block samiti elections ended amid allegations of violence and a subdued voter response, with only 48 per cent turnout recorded across the state.

content: Israeli leaders condemned a shooting in Sydney targeting a Hanukkah celebration that killed 11 people on Sunday, with various government officials suggesting Australia had failed to combat hatred of Jews.

title: If this was Salah's Liverpool farewell, he delivered fitting end
content: Mohamed Salah's side beat Brighton 2-0 in the premier league . Salah overtook Wayne Rooney to claim the record for goal contributions by a player for a single club in the era . the 33-year-old could have added more gloss to that tally if he not spurned a glorious late opportunity .

content: quarterback Patrick Mahomes left the Chiefs' loss late in the fourth quarter with a knee injury . the quarterbacks denied the Patriots a chance to clinch the AFC East title . texans and Jaguars also scored 40-plus points in dominant victories .

content: davante Adams suffered a noncontact hamstring injury . the wide receiver walked off the field and headed to the locker room . he was "optimistic" about the injury, coach says . his status for Thursday's game against the seahawks is in doubt .

content: a week ago, the Bengals quarterback clarified his position on where things stand in his career . he was 25-of-39 passing for 225 yards, no touchdowns and two interceptions . "my comments had nothing to do with me," he said after the game .

title: Privacy settings to 'public': Trump tightens H-1B screening; social media checks from December 15
content: US visa applicants, including H-1B workers and their families, must now make social media profiles public for enhanced screening. This directive, effective December 15, extends existing measures for students and exchange visitors. The State Department views visa decisions as national security matters, utilizing all available information to vet applicants for potential risks.

title: Delhi Airmergency: City gasps on 2nd dirtiest Dec air day; AQI reaches â€˜severe-plusâ€™ category
content: Delhi was shrouded in an oppressive smog veil this past Sunday, as air quality reached a staggering 'severe-plus' for the first time in 2023. The 24-hour AQI clocked in at 461, recording one of the worst Decembers ever documented. High moisture levels, cool temperatures, and stagnant winds conspired to keep pollutants hovering low, dimming the sky.

title: 3rd T20I: Seamers wreak havoc; India thrash SA by 7 wickets to go 2-1 up
content: India secured a commanding 2-1 series lead against South Africa, thanks to exceptional swing bowling from Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana.  The duo dismantled the Proteas' top order, restricting them to a mere 117.  Aiden Markram's valiant 61 was the lone highlight for the visitors. India's chase was then comfortably navigated, ensuring a seven-wicket victory.

title: AI models: Oracle founder lists 2 types, says Muskâ€™s Tesla uses â€˜low-latencyâ€™
content: Oracle founder Larry Ellison distinguished between two AI model types: those requiring real-time, low-latency decisions for applications like self-driving cars and robotics, and those where delays are acceptable, such as chatbots. He highlighted Tesla's use of local compute for immediate responses, emphasizing that both categories are crucial for AI's future.

title: Brown University shooting: Did â€˜person of interestâ€™ Erickson serve in army? What you need to know
content: Benjamin Erickson, a 24-year-old former US Army infantryman, was named a person of interest in the Brown University shooting that killed two students and injured nine. He was arrested at a hotel after an 11-hour manhunt. Investigators are examining his ties to the university and potential mental health issues, though no charges have been filed.

title: Billionaire with 100+ US-born kids dreams of marrying them into Elon Muskâ€™s family
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly fathered over 100 US-born children via surrogacy, aiming to create a family dynasty and marry them to Elon Musk's offspring.  His ex-girlfriend claims he fathered over 300 children. A California judge rejected his petition for parental rights for several unborn children.

title: AI comeback question: Did Sergey Brin help save Google? Sundar Pichai breaks it down
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin's return to hands-on AI development, coding and analyzing training loss curves, has coincided with the company's recent AI surge. While not a formal executive, his technical insight and urgency reinforced Google's accelerated execution, particularly with the Gemini models. This renewed focus has repositioned Google as a top-tier AI competitor.

title: Messi in Mumbai: CM Fadnavis, Ajay Devgn & Tiger Shroff booed by crowd - Watch
content: Bollywood stars Ajay Devgn and Tiger Shroff were booed by fans at Wankhede Stadium during Lionel Messi's event. The crowd's displeasure was evident during the felicitation ceremony. Many spectators seemed more interested in seeing Messi than the celebrities. Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis also faced jeers. The mood improved when Sachin Tendulkar met Messi.

title: â€˜Behaved indecentlyâ€™: Rapido biker held for molesting female passenger in Thane; knife recovered
content: A 19-year-old Rapido driver was arrested in Kalyan for allegedly molesting and attempting to rob a 26-year-old female passenger. The accused diverted the ride to a deserted road, where he indecently behaved with the victim and snatched her purse. Local residents intervened, apprehending the driver before handing him over to the police.

title: Climate migration begins: Tuvaluans relocate to Australia; special visas take effect
content: Australia has welcomed the first climate migrants from Tuvalu, a Pacific nation facing inundation due to rising sea levels. A groundbreaking bilateral treaty allows Tuvaluans to live, study, and work in Australia, receiving immediate access to essential services. This initiative offers a dignified pathway as the island nation grapples with existential threats from climate change.

title: 'Dhurandhar': Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan starrer breaks record; crosses Rs 350 cr
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is a box office sensation, crossing â‚¹350 crore in just 10 days. The Aditya Dhar directorial has outshone 'Pushpa 2' on its second Sunday and is now aiming to surpass 'KGF Chapter 2's lifetime earnings. The action-packed film opened strong and continues to maintain impressive momentum.

title: â€˜Not all equalâ€™: Survivor slams Kerala court verdict in actor rape case; questions Dileep acquittal
content: The survivor in the actor abduction case expressed deep disappointment with the trial court's verdict, which acquitted actor Dileep. While grateful for the conviction of six other accused, she stated her fundamental rights were not protected and questioned the fairness of the proceedings, citing evidence tampering and a hostile court environment. She also refuted claims of knowing the prime accused.

title: â€˜You fuel antisemitismâ€™: Netanyahu slams Australian PM; links Palestine stance to Sydney attack
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticized Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's support for a Palestinian state, linking it to rising antisemitism following a deadly shooting in Sydney. Netanyahu asserted that calls for Palestinian statehood "pour fuel on the antisemitic fire," a stance he has consistently maintained amid the Gaza war and international pressure for a two-state solution.

title: Connor McDavidâ€™s wife, Lauren Kyle launches Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of NHL star Connor McDavid, is launching a Canada-inspired collection for her brand, Sports Club Atelier, in January. Drawing inspiration from vintage winter advertising and alpine campaigns, the line features red-and-white pieces designed for fans to express patriotic pride fashionably at sporting events and in everyday life.

title: NHL Update: Connor McDavid reacts to Oilers trading Skinner, Kulak
content: The Edmonton Oilers made a significant roster change, trading goalie Stuart Skinner and defenseman Brett Kulak to the Pittsburgh Penguins for Tristan Jarry and Spencer Stastney. While the move addressed goaltending needs, it was acknowledged as a difficult decision by players like Connor McDavid and Head Coach Kris Knoblauch, who praised the departing players' contributions.

title: Where Does Auston Matthews Live? Inside Leafs Starâ€™s Homes and Wealth
content: Auston Matthews' net worth is estimated at $30 million in 2025, driven by his substantial NHL salary and lucrative endorsement deals with major brands like Nike and RBC. Beyond hockey, he has strategically invested in startups and actively supports men's health through philanthropy, showcasing a multi-faceted financial profile.

title: Vanessa Bryant gets emotional as UConn, USC honor Kobe and Gigi with tribute
content: The UConn Huskies beat the USC Trojans by 28 points. The game became emotional as players honored Kobe and Gigi Bryant. Both teams wore different Kobe sneakers. Vanessa Bryant shared pictures of the athletes on her Instagram. This tribute highlighted the lasting impact of Kobe and Gigi on basketball. Gigi had wished to play for UConn.

title: Reasons for Messi mess: Neta clans' selfie rush, VIP culture, outsider entry; damage worth Rs 2.5 cr
content: The electrifying atmosphere at Salt Lake Stadium turned sour during Messi's visit, when eager fans found themselves unable to catch a glimpse of their idol. A misguided attempt by a VIP to secure an autograph sparked concerns for safety, forcing an early departure for the soccer legend.

title: 'Used tracking feature': Earbud squeals, thief at B'luru PG caught; laptop, credit cards recovered
content: A quick-thinking theft victim's earbud tracking feature led to the swift arrest of a thief within 11 hours. The suspect, Raghava, stole a laptop, phones, and cards from a Bengaluru PG. Police, guided by the earbud's live location, apprehended Raghava in Tamil Nadu, uncovering a potential ring of thieves.

title: How Ronaldo, Beckham and footballâ€™s richest stars fly in 2025: 5 luxury jets
content: Elite footballers rely on private jets for swift travel, crucial for performance, recovery, and security. Stars like Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi, Neymar Jr., Zlatan IbrahimoviÄ‡, and David Beckham utilize luxurious aircraft such as Gulfstreams and Bombardiers. Beyond the hefty purchase price, operational costs are substantial, making private aviation a necessity for their demanding global lifestyles.

title: Patriots WR Mack Hollins steals show going shirtless and barefoot in the cold
content: Patriots receiver Mack Hollins made a memorable entrance for a snow-filled game, arriving shirtless and barefoot despite freezing temperatures. This bold display, shared widely online, highlights his unique approach to training and embracing natural movement, a philosophy he adopted years ago from Australian trainers. Hollins appeared unfazed by the extreme weather, engaging with teammates.

title: Canucks injury update: Marco Rossi activated as Elias Pettersson lands on IR
content: Vancouver Canucks have made a roster change. Elias Pettersson is on injured reserve due to an upper-body injury. Marco Rossi has been activated and will play. Pettersson is a top scorer for the team. Rossi joins after an injury. Fans expect Rossi to make an impact. This move comes at a crucial time for the Canucks.

title: Brown University shooting: Suspect identified as 24-year-old Benjamin Erickson â€” who is he?
content: Authorities have named 24-year-old Benjamin Erickson as the suspect in a fatal Brown University shooting that claimed two lives and injured nine. Erickson, a former Army Infantryman, has no prior criminal record but investigators are probing a potential extensive mental health history and any links to the university. He was previously registered to vote in Wisconsin and Washington D.C.

title: Joe Bidenâ€™s Eagles game appearance sparks chatter over Trump comparison
content: Former US President Joe Biden attended an Eagles football game. He was seen wearing an Eagles cap and practical, layered clothing. His appearance and outfit became a talking point online. Many appreciated his comfortable and engaged presence at the stadium. The event blended sports, politics, and pop culture, creating a buzz.

title: Lionel Messi, Sachin share No. 10 moment; Chhetri leads football fiesta
content: Lionel Messi's hour-long visit to Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium during his GOAT India Tour 2025 was a resounding success, delighting fans and dignitaries alike. He shared a memorable moment with cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, presented with a signed jersey. The event also saw the launch of Project Maha-deva to support young footballers.

title: Diggsâ€“Cardi B romance stirs buzz after fans spot him with alleged baby mama
content: NFL star Stefon Diggs is reportedly facing renewed speculation about an alleged pregnancy with Kâ€™yanna Barber, even as he and Cardi B celebrate their new baby. A recent video has fans convinced Diggs was seen with Barber, though this remains unconfirmed. Despite the ongoing rumors, Diggs and Cardi B appear to be happy and in love.

title: Pink tax, safety tax, health tax & more: The 'hidden cost' of being a woman no one counts
content: Do women end up paying hidden taxes just to survive? From the 'pink tax' to 'safety tax' and more, where women pay more for gendered products and essential safety measures. Does simply existing as a woman become financially and emotionally more expensive, a burden society continues to overlook but hard to escape.

title: Bondi beach mass shooting: Video captures people fleeing to nearby cafe for cover - watch
content: Tragedy struck Sydney's Bondi Beach as two suspected shooters opened fire, claiming nine lives and injuring eleven. Panic erupted as beachgoers fled the popular tourist spot. One assailant was killed, the other critically wounded. The attack occurred near a Hanukkah celebration, prompting condemnation from Israeli President Isaac Herzog as a "cruel attack on Jews."

title: Neurosurgeon explains why Japanese people live longer and healthier lives
content: A neurosurgeon reveals Japan's exceptional longevity stems not just from diet, but from daily habits. Consistent routines, mindful eating with smaller portions, integrated physical activity, and strong social connections significantly reduce strain on the nervous system and metabolism. This approach fosters healthier aging, emphasizing preventive care and a balanced lifestyle over quick fixes.

title: Congress leader Shamanuru Shivashankarappa passes away at 95; tributes pour in
content: Shamanuru Shivashankarappa, a seasoned politician and revered six-time MLA, has sadly passed away at the age of 95 after battling age-related ailments. His commitment to the upliftment of education and community service marked his illustrious career. His departure is a significant loss for Karnataka's political landscape and the Veerashaiva-Lingayat community, prompting leaders from all sides to express their condolences.

title: 'Bang bang bang': Eyewitnesses recount panic during Bondi Beach shooting; death toll rises to 16
content: Tragedy struck Bondi Beach as a violent shooting left eleven dead and several injured. Eyewitnesses described a terrifying scene of continuous gunfire, with reports of two gunmen. Panic ensued as people fled the popular tourist spot, with victims seen on the ground. Authorities confirmed one shooter was killed and another critically wounded.

title: IPL Auction: Ahead of the curve â€” Pandya's MI enter with little to worry
content: Mumbai Indians, a formidable IPL side, enter the 2026 auction with a strong squad after a successful 2025 season. Despite a few areas for refinement, their existing talent pool, including stars like Bumrah and Suryakumar Yadav, positions them as strong contenders to end their title drought. Hardik Pandya's side looks formidable enough to take on any team.

title: South's 'Ayodhya' moment? Why Karthigai deepam row matters beyond Tamil Nadu
content: Thiruparankundram, a hill in Tamil Nadu with a history of religious coexistence, is now a flashpoint for political and legal battles. A dispute over lighting a sacred lamp during the Karthigai deepam festival has escalated, pitting the DMK against the BJP and raising questions about judicial authority and communal harmony.

title: Suns vs Lakers (Dec 14): Preview, injury report, lineups and how to watch
content: The Lakers, 17-7, face the surprising 14-11 Phoenix Suns on the road after an NBA Cup elimination. Despite injuries, the Suns, led by Dillon Brooks and coaching, have been competitive. The Lakers, coming off a defensive lapse, will rely on Luka Doncic and LeBron James against a tenacious Phoenix squad.

title: BJP gets new chief: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin appointed working president
content: Nitin Nabin has been appointed as the new national working president of the Bharatiya Janata Party, succeeding JP Nadda. A PWD minister in Bihar and MLA from Patna's Bankipur constituency, Nabin's political journey began in student politics with the ABVP. He has established himself as a key urban and infrastructure leader since entering electoral politics in the late 2000s.

title: Sydney: Bondi Beach shooting toll rises to 12; one gunman killed, other critical
content: A horrific shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach has claimed at least 12 lives, with authorities labeling it a terrorist incident. Police responded to the developing situation, urging the public to avoid the area. The attack occurred during a Hanukkah celebration, prompting condemnation and calls to combat antisemitism.

content: Autopsy-based research shows coronary artery disease remains the leading cause; calls for targeted public health measures

title: IFFK 2025: fallout in a post-dictatorship society might be visible only as time passes, says Chilean filmmaker Pablo Larrain
content: The iconic director of films set around the Augusto Pinochet regime speaks on politics and observation in independent cinema at the 30th International Film Festival of Kerala

title: 2 held in Assam over death of 21 workers in Arunachal
content: Rescue teams have recovered 20 bodies from a 200-metre gorge near Chaglagam in Arunachal Pradeshâ€™s Anjaw district, while two persons were arrested for illegally supplying labour to the State

title: LDF, UDF on the hunt for mayoral candidates in Kozhikode Corporation
content: The LDF will not be able to rule the Corporation without the support of at least a few councillors from either the UDF or the NDA; DCC president says UDF will put up a strong fight for the post of Mayor

title: Govt. committed to equitable development of all regions, says Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra
content: He says substantial investments are flowing into the State due to the pro-industry policies of the government

title: Veteran Congress leader Shamanur Shivashankarappa passes away at 94
content: The Karnataka Congress leader was the National president of the Akhila Bharata Veerashaiva Mahasabha and a prominent face of the Veerashaiva-Lingayat community

title: All eyes on Independent candidates in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: Though BJP achieved a big win in the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, it has fallen one short of the required majority number of 51 in the council

title: Keep writing to showcase lacunae in society and record differences with majority: Jnanpith awardee Damodar Mauzo
content: Jnanpith awardee Damodar Mauzo says it is important to keep writing to showcase the lacunae in the society and to record our difference with the majority and then only an awakening was possible

title: Efftronics poised to tap emerging opportunities in diverse fields
content: Formed on December 15, 1985, ESPL is today the largest provider of data logger systems and Internet of Things (IoT)-based solutions to the Railways, and has up to 70 products in other fields

title: Post-poll LDF leadership meeting to analyse results to plot a path back to retaining power in the 2026 Assembly polls
content: LDF will examine whether campaigns on expanded social security net and achievements in infrastructure development crowded out ruling front conversations about voter-relevant local issues, pivotal to the local body polls

title: Bommai appeals not to oppose Bedti-Varada river linking project based on misconceptions
content: MP and Former Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has appealed to activists and seers not to oppose the Bedti and Varada river linking project based on misconceptions as the project has been revised to ensure better utilisation of water

title: Actor assault case: court questions SITâ€™s omission of woman whom Suni contacted as witness
content: Court finds that SIT did not cite Sreelakshmi, whom the convict Pulsar Suni contacted and messaged while he was travelling with the survivor on the fateful day.

title: Tiruchi district remains one of the top tourist destinations in  T.N.
content: Tiruchi district occupied top slot by attracting 23.09 lakh tourists in August while Madurai, which drew 21.65 tourists, remains a top draw with foreign travellers

title: Neglect of SW hostel students will not be tolerated, says Minister Savitha
content: She directs officials to provide best medical treatment to the two students of SC hostel injured in road accident in Sri Sathya Sai district

title: Deadline for completing new integrated terminal at Vijayawada airport pushed to March 31
content: Commissioning of the new terminal is likely to take two more months; currently, over 80% of the terminal has been completed, including glass work, interiors, flooring and baggage strip

title: Recovery and reconstruction in Gaza not going to be easy: Palestinian Ambassador
content: â€œMore than 90% of the people have been internally displaced. A vast majority is living in tents in this winter. The infrastructure is totally collapsed.â€

title: Stop attacks on BRS workers or face retaliation: KTR to Congress
content: He along with party leaders visit the bereaved family of party worker who was killed in an attack allegedly by Congressmen recently

title: UDFâ€™s victory in Erumely refuses to translate to power
content: The post of panchayat president has been reserved for an ST member, and no one from UDFâ€™s elected panel is from the community. However, both LDF and NDA have one ST member, making them eligible to claim the post

title: Inter-IIT sports meet kicks off at IIT-Hyderabad

title: Labour courts in limbo as new labour codes yet to be brought into force

title: ISRO lines up 7 launches, including uncrewed Gaganyaan mission by March 2026
content: The human-rated LVM3 will soar into the sky early next year, carrying the first uncrewed mission of India's human spaceflight Gaganyaan with a robot 'Vyommitra' onboard the crew module
